pros: Great boss. Great environment. Flexible schedules. Independent work.
cons: No cons. Indiana just has low minimum wage.

review_title: My Worst Job in over 30 Years
job_title: Academic ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR in Crawfordsville, IN
pros: Campus is beautiful, and there are some wonderful coworkers. Students are respectful and nice. Some professors are wonderful to work with.
cons: Some professors will tell you do things that are against the college's policies that may also go against copyright laws and business credit card purchasing laws. Some Professors have anger issues and will yell at each other and at the people who work for them. The ongoing feuding of departments will put you in the cross fire. Some professors act as they are above others, and will treat you as such. Low pay. Watch your paysubs as HR will make MANY mistakes in regards to benefits when you start working.

job_title: Director of Safety and Security in Crawfordsville, IN
pros: Great benefits, extensive flexibility, lots of time off
cons: Political, image focused, not policy driven, indecisive, employees have lack of real world knowledge. Frustrating place to work

pros: Helped me to build communication skills
cons: Had to give a lot of tours

pros: Very flexible with faculty and staff during COVID.
cons: Dental benefits could be better

pros: School provides many opportunities for employment
cons: Hours scheduled for you take away free time

pros: Great place to work at
cons: Sometimes can get a bit tiring

pros: Amazing school and instituion to work for as a student worker.
cons: Nothing. Student workers here are treated well.

pros: School is a fun time
cons: Not too many honestly here

pros: I am a student worker
cons: There are no downsides to Wabash

review_title: Great way to get work experience while in school
pros: As an ESH worker, you get access to the school's pretend money, which helps you either pay less in tuition or put some money in your pocket or both. There are a number of positions around campus that will give you solid work experience and meaningful responsibilities. At the same time, other positions involve sitting at a desk with headphones on for 4 straights hours doing homework. Which can be a pro if you just want to get some homework done! Just be sure to know which sort of position you are getting yourself into before you apply.
cons: All of the ESH positions paid the same. A student that mans a desk in the Allen Center for 4 hours and a student that shovels snow for 4 hours are paid the same hourly rate. Some positions can also either not offer enough hours or demand too many hours/inconvenient hours. Many of the positions lead to no personal or professional growth and instead are used to get busywork done.

review_title: Great place to work, but politics are a factor
pros: Most people are great to work with and the atmosphere is one of relaxed professionalism with a passion for the school.
cons: Upper management can be extremely stubborn, acting at times unilaterally without input from lower level employees who may be better informed.

review_title: I have had minimal negative experience working here and could not see myself leaving for a long while.
pros: Focus on the people. The employees of the college are all in a friendly and hospitable environment and I always enjoy interacting with everyone everyday
cons: I don't have any cons here. I attended Wabash and work for Wabash. The fact that I came back to work for them speaks for itself.

review_title: Fulfilling work in a rural area
pros:
-The small campus community leads to engaging relationships
-The community is great for families (in many ways)
-Students are diverse, interesting, and overall engaged
-Lots of opportunities for pursuing interests and leadership on campus
cons:
-Leadership is spotty--some are excellent, others uninspired
-Campus politics can be amplified in such a small place
-Focus on faculty leaves some staff dissatisfied with work-compensation
-Area lacks many amenities of larger cities

job_title: Fitness Desk Worker in Crawfordsville, IN
pros: Working as a student employee, jobs around campus can vary. Some are more laid back, and allow you to do homework. Others are not, and they have you do more work. However, these jobs help build resume's, which is beneficial to future job searching.
cons: From time to time, there are glitches with the time in system.

review_title: Full employment opportunity while maintaining an engaged academic presence.
pros: There were available hours to fit your class schedule and you could work as much as you needed to.
cons: The only downside of any position is that you may have to miss some shifts based on extracurricular involvement but most supervisors understand and handle it accordingly.

pros: I was working an on campus job at Wabash College. Good employer. Takes care of you.
cons: The jobs here require different expertise (i'm talking about on campus jobs for students) but they pay the same

pros:
As a lifeguard, I didn't have to do very much.  Lots of freedom, and a friendly workplace.
The pay of 10/hr made it that much better.
cons: Annoying townies that come in to the pool for hours on end

pros: A close and supportive community, fresh ideas and innovation, small-scale enough to be able to adapt quickly.
cons: Small environment can get dreary if you're looking for a big-city type place, and it doesn't have the same budget as larger places

job_title: Administrative and Recruiting Assistant in Crawfordsville, IN
pros: The small school and small staff created a caring environment on a personal level.
cons: There is very little room for advancement from an administrative position to any other position on campus.

pros: It is one of the most interesting college in the USA and it is turn to international
